info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued October 6 at 7:34PM EDT until October 7 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one foot of inundation above ground level in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected.
* WHERE...Coastal Horry and Coastal Georgetown Counties.
* WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 11 AM EDT Tuesday. For the High Rip Current Risk, from 6 AM EDT Tuesday through Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS...Low-lying roads and locations near the beaches, the Intracoastal Waterway, and adjacent tidal creeks will observe minor coastal flooding. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction:
Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

parameter.value: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT TUESDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM EDT TUESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING
